name: Lobe Chat
description: An open-source, modern-design AI chat framework supporting multiple AI providers (OpenAI, Claude 3, Gemini, Ollama, Qwen, DeepSeek), knowledge base, multi-modals, and one-click free deployment.

content.overview: Lobe Chat is an open-source, modern-design AI chat framework that supports multiple AI providers including OpenAI, Claude 3, Gemini, Ollama, Qwen, and DeepSeek. It features a knowledge base for file uploads and RAG capabilities, multi-modal functionalities (vision, TTS, plugins), and offers one-click free deployment of private ChatGPT/Claude applications. With over 52k stars on GitHub, it offers an elegant, user-friendly interface with both light and dark themes, mobile responsiveness, and PWA support for a native-like experience.

faqs.question: How do I deploy Lobe Chat?
faqs.answer: You can deploy Lobe Chat with one click using Vercel, Zeabur, Sealos, or Docker. Documentation provides detailed instructions for each method.

faqs.question: Which AI models are supported?
faqs.answer: Lobe Chat supports multiple AI providers including OpenAI (GPT models), Anthropic (Claude), Google (Gemini), Ollama (local models), Qwen, DeepSeek, and more.

faqs.question: Is Lobe Chat free to use?
faqs.answer: Yes, Lobe Chat is open-source under the Apache 2.0 license. You can deploy and use it for free, though you may need API keys for the various AI providers.

faqs.question: Does it support mobile devices?
faqs.answer: Yes, Lobe Chat features a responsive design and supports Progressive Web App (PWA) functionality for a more native-like experience on mobile devices.
